sentences.en: A car and a van collided on the motorway.
sentences.cn: 一辆汽车和一辆小型货车在高速公路上相撞了。

sentences.en: Fender - bender . In the distant future, Earth could collide with another planet.
sentences.cn: 在遥远的将来, 地球可能与其他行星相撞.

sentences.en: If the aims of two countries collide, there may be war.
sentences.cn: 如果两国目标严重对立, 就有可能爆发战争.

sentences.en: If two crane collide, use journey switch turn off the power.
sentences.cn: 如果两行车相碰, 也用行程开关断开电源.

sentences.en: Molecules repel each other when they collide.
sentences.cn: 当分子相碰撞时彼此互斥.

sentences.en: Some of the electrons or ions then collide with the drops and stick to them.
sentences.cn: 这时有些电子或离子与油滴碰撞而粘附在油滴上.

sentences.en: Sometimes these clusters collide and merge with one another.
sentences.cn: 有时,这些星系团之间会发生碰撞,并合二为一.

sentences.en: The aims of the negotiators in New York again seem likely to collide with the aims of the warriors in the field.
sentences.cn: 看来，纽约谈判人员的目标可能会再次与战场上勇士们的目标发生冲突。

sentences.en: The interests of the two countries collide.
The President has again collided with Congress over his budget plans.
sentences.cn: 总统在预算计划上又一次与国会发生冲突。

sentences.en: The tides slide on the tidy wide beach and collide each other.
sentences.cn: 海潮在整洁宽阔的海滩上滑行并相互碰撞。

sentences.en: Two trains collided head-on (= when they were moving directly towards each other ) .
We were about to collide head - on in the defense debate.
sentences.cn: 我们在国防辩论上即将正面发生冲突.

sentences.en: We were struck with horror when we saw the car collide.
sentences.cn: 我们看到车子相撞,大吃一惊.

sentences.en: What happens when the two interests collide will make a fascinating spectacle.
sentences.cn: 两种利益发生冲突时将会上演一场好戏。

sentences.en: When the highly energized particles collide with atmospheric gases.
sentences.cn: 当这些高能量的粒子与大气层的气体发生碰撞.

sentences.en: When truths collide, compromise becomes the first casualty ( Henry A. Kissinger )
sentences.cn: 当事实相互抵触时, 首当其冲的受害者是妥协 ( 亨利A. 基辛格 )

sentences.en: Where two continental plates collide the plates either buckle and compress.
sentences.cn: 当两块大陆板块碰撞到一起,任何一块地壳板块都会产生变形和压缩.

trans.tran_en: to hit something or someone that is moving in a different direction from you

trans.tran_cn: 碰撞， 互撞； 冲突， 抵触
trans.tran_en: to hit something or someone that is moving in a different direction from you
